message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.DC

This paper discusses the use of malware to propagate through intermediate hosts in communication systems, which is a common topic in the computer security (cs.CR) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories. The paper also draws connections between transmissive attacks and epidemic models, which falls under the systems and control (cs.SY) and social and information networks (cs.SI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses simulations, experiments, and ongoing research challenges, which could also be relevant to the distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) sub-category.
